Key Match Events: Weston Wilson drove in the tiebreaking run with an infield single down the third-base line.
Nick Castellanos homered and Zack Wheeler struck out nine batters over six innings.
Wilson’s hit came with two outs in the sixth and allowed Castellanos to score from third.
Castellanos was hit by a pitch by Kevin Kelly in the eighth inning.
Wheeler allowed two runs and four hits over six innings to earn the win.
Carlos Estevez pitched a scoreless ninth for his 25th save.
The Rays scored their two runs off Wheeler on an RBI single by Taylor Walls in the second and a solo home run by Jonathan Aranda in the sixth.
Pre-Game Insights: Kyle Schwarber was scratched after feeling discomfort in his left elbow during batting practice.
Schwarber was removed from the game on Tuesday after hyperextending the elbow while diving into first base on a pickoff attempt.
Post-Match Reflections: Nick Castellanos expressed respect for Tampa manager Kevin Cash for apologizing for the intentional hit by pitch incident.
Zack Wheeler reflected on his performance, stating it was a battle and he got through six innings despite not having his best command.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies reduced their magic number to clinch their first National League East title since 2011 to nine.
The Phillies have been getting a lot of production from players who spent most of the year at Triple-A Lehigh Valley.
